Hello explorers!
I'm Sarah fromSarah Rows Solo

4.text:
I'm a real life explorer
and today I'm exploring the question

7.text:
of how long do seagulls live?
Hello explorers!

14.text:
The word seagull is
a generic word

55.text:
used to refer to the different species
of gull

57.text:
that not only live by the sea
but also in bays and inland

61.text:
where there is no sea.
It's a bit of a funny word really

65.text:
seagull.
The smallest gull is the

67.text:
little gull
which weighs around 120 grammes

73.text:
And the biggest of the gulls
is the great black beaked gull

76.text:
which weighs 1.75 kg
and is 75 centimetres tall.

81.text:
Now most gulls takes around two years to get
their

84.text:
adult feathers
but the large white headed gulls

87.text:
can take around four years to reach
adulthood.

90.text:
The gull that lives the longest
is the herring gull

93.text:
and the oldest one recorded
actually lived for around 49 years.

97.text:
But most gulls live for probably between
15-20 years.

102.text:
Gulls belong to the family 'laridae'
or 'laridae'

105.text:
I'm not quite sure how you pronounce it
which is Greek for

108.text:
'ravenous sea bird'.
But remember not all gulls live by the sea.

112.text:
Gulls are well known for their scavenging
behaviour

116.text:
and they will eat
pretty much everything

117.text:
from garbage on a rubbish dump
to dead animals

122.text:
fish.
So how long do seagulls live?

125.text:
Well most of the gull species live
for between 15-20 years

128.text:
but the herring gull
can live for around
